abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Project Completion Note
            (PCN) for the Port Modernization Project in Somalia. The
            overall performance of the project was moderate, performance
            of the Banks was satisfactory, and the borrowers performance
            during the implementation of the project in many respects
            was deficient. Due to the outbreak of hostilities and the
            deteriorating security situation in the country resulting in
            the collapse of the Government of Somalia, the Bank
            suspended all operations in December 1990 and disbursements
            on March 15, 1991. Final disbursement took place on January
            8, 1991, at which time the credit balance was undisbursed.
            The Danish International Development Agency (DANIDA) under a
            parallel financing arrangement with the Government of
            Somalia (GOS), financed the consulting engineering
            supervision component of the project. The objectives of the
            Port Modernization Project were to: (i) assist Somali Ports
            Authority (SPA) to meet the changes in cargo handling
            brought about by new shipping technology; and (ii) to
            maximize the utilization of existing facilities. Lessons
            learned are as follows: a project of this complexity
            required varying levels and type of engineering
            constructions skills and resources to enable successful
            execution of the project. Additionally, the project required
            the organizational capability and project management skills
            to enable a contractor to perform at multiple sites. It also
            required effective coordination and supervision by the
            borrower and the Bank. Each of these factors was found to
            have been deficient under this project. More attention must
            be given to how the project is to be organized, managed, and
            implemented by the borrower, its implementing agencies, and
            supervision and follow-up by the Bank.
